strapiPost.title: ArDOT Conducting New Study To Improve Traffic Congestion
strapiPost.content:
Northwest Arkansas’ population is booming, and it’s not too hard to tell some days when we’re stuck in traffic. 

  • Road work: As an update to the Congestion Management Process, which will no longer be up for public comment after today, the Northwest Arkansas Regional Planning Commission is conducting a new study to look at the most congested areas and how to fix them. 
  • In the plan: Some of the work we’ll see completed in the next five to ten years is the airport access road, segments of the 612 bypass, and the highway 112 corridor 18 miles from Fayetteville to Bentonville. 

Click HERE to view the study’s draft.
